skillTree.localised_description: A general's horse can be their most trusted and daring companion. Just don't name him 'Daisy'.
Loyal, fierce, powerful and surprisingly fast â€“ a War Bear is a symbol of Kislev itself.
Naught can penetrate the swirling mists of ice and sleet that churn around those afforded Father Bear's protection.
Long has peace in the Old World been bought with the blood of Kislev. When Ruination descends, none are more ready to meet it than the hardy guardians of the north.

ui_effects.localised_text: Summoned unit has increased melee attack and melee defence
Summoned unit has greatly increased melee attack and melee defence

skillTree.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say noâ€¦

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Most Kislevites are used to walk and ride days on puruit of roaming Chaos warbands and other invaders.
A Kislevite army without vodka is like a bear without teeth and claws.
Our gods stand with us in the battlefield, protecting us from the Dark Powers.

effects.description:
Magic Resistance: +8% for Torch Bearers of Dazh, Sons of ursun, Claws of Ursun, and Hammers of Tor units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: We have endured the attacks of the servants of the Dark Powers for centuries, and we will keep doing it as long as one of us still breaths.

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Again, again, again! We'll practice this until your fingers bleed!"

skillTree.localised_description: The thunderous pounding of Kislevite hooves can be heard for leagues around, even muffled by the crunch of fresh snow.

skillTree.localised_description: The beasts that roam the forests of Kislev are somehow even more lethal than the land they inhabit.

skillTree.localised_description: The warriors of the north carry conflict in their blood, a legacy left by the Khan-Kings and Khan-Queens of old.

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Descended of the proud horse-warriors of the Gospodar, all Kislevites are born to the saddle like their ancestors before them.

skillTree.localised_description: "Ursun is with us, brothers! None can stand against the beasts of the Bear-God!"

skillTree.localised_description: The workshops of the north are always busy, their engineers working tirelessly in the pursuit of battle excellence.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors
